titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the John Daniel Wild Papers
titlestmt.author: by Diane J Ducharme

publicationstmt.publisher: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Saturday December 8, 2018 at 06:53

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

did.abstract: The collection contains writings, lecture notes, syllabi, research notes and notebooks and other materials documenting the scholarly career of American philosopher John Daniel Wild. In particular, the papers concern Wild's work on aspects of Phenomenology and Existentialism during the last decades of his career.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift of Mrs. John Wild, 1975; gift of Richard Sugarman, 2004.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The John Daniel Wild Papers are the physical property of the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University. Literary rights, including copyright, belong to the authors or their legal heirs and assigns. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: John Daniel Wild Papers. General Collection, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection received a basic level of processing, including rehousing and minimal organization, in 2012.

Information included in the Description of Papers note and Collection Contents section is drawn from information supplied with the collection, including a donor list, and from an initial survey of the contents. Folder titles appearing in the contents list below are often based on those provided by the creator or previous custodian. Titles have not been verified against the contents of the folders in all cases. Otherwise, folder titles were supplied by staff during basic processing.
Former call numbers: Uncat MS Vault Wild; Uncat MSS 733

bioghist.head: John Daniel Wild (1902-1972)
bioghist.p: John Daniel Wild, American philosopher, was born in Chicago, Illinois. He received his B.A. from the University of Chicago and his M.A. from Harvard University. He completed his Ph.D at the University of Chicago in 1926. After teaching for one year at the University of Michigan, Wild joined the Harvard faculty and taught there until 1961.In that year he became chair of the philosophy department at Northwestern University, then a leading center for the study of Phenomenology. He left Northwestern to join the Yale faculty in 1963; his final academic position was with the University of Florida.

His works included Plato's Theory of Man (1946); Plato's Modern Enemies and the Theory of Natural Law (1953); The Challenge of Existentialism (1955); and The Radical Empiricism of William James (1969). Wild was also one of the founders of the Society for Phenomenology and Existential Philosophy.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection contains writings, lecture notes, syllabi, research notes and notebooks and other materials documenting the scholarly career of American philosopher John Daniel Wild. In particular, the papers concern Wild's work on aspects of Phenomenology and Existentialism during the last decades of his career.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized in two groupings: I. 1974 Acquisition, 1943-1974; II. 2004 Acquisition, 1934-1972.

Material within this collection has been organized by acquisition reflecting the fact that the collection has been acquired in increments over time. Researchers should note that material within each acquisition overlaps with/or relates to material found in other acquisitions. For instance, writings and lecture notes can be found in both groupings. In order to locate all relevant material within this collection, researchers will need to consult each acquisition described in the Collection Contents section.
Researchers should also note that similar material can be arranged differently in each acquisition, depending on how the material was organized when it was received by the library.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Not arranged in any particular order.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Writings, lecture notes, syllabi, research notes and other material documenting the scholarly career of John Daniel Wild.

Folder titles in quotation marks are transcribed from the original folder labels in the hand of John Daniel Wild. Folders typically contain a variety of material, not all of which may be accounted for in the folder label.
Former call number: Uncat MS Vault Wild

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged by subject and/or type of material by the donor.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Notebooks, writings, lecture notes and subject files documenting the scholarly career of John Daniel Wild. Folder titles are derived from the detailed donor list, which is located in Box 12, folder 1.

did.unittitle: Bibliography of John Wild's Unpublished Writings , by Richard I. Sugarman

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes detailed list of the contents of this acquisition.

scopecontent.p: Contents include notes on Aristotle, Hegel and Kant

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Essays in preparation for publication by Wild. Contents include a draft of Rights of the Other and Existential A Priori .
